intro: Bonania cubana, commonly known as the Cuban bonania, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Bonania cubana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
